clinical_study.brief_title: Vaccination Status, Knowledge and Attitude in Korean Patients With IBD
clinical_study.official_title: Vaccination Status, Knowledge About Vaccination and Attitude to Vaccination in Korean Patients With Inflammatory Bowel Diseases

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the vaccination status, knowledge about vaccination, and attitude to vaccination of the Korean patients with inflammatory bowel diseases

detailed_description.textblock: Using structured questionnaires, the vaccination status, knowledge about vaccination, and attitude to vaccination of the Korean patients with inflammatory bowel diseases will be investigated. The descriptive analyses will be performed and the factors influencing the vaccination status, knowledge, and attitude will be investigated.

primary_outcome.measure: Vaccination status (MMR, DTaP, BCG, Polio, seasonal influenza, pneumococcus, HAV, HBV, HPV, VZV, and menigococcus )

secondary_outcome.measure: Knowledge about vaccination in patients with inflammatory bowel diseases

other_outcome.measure: Attitude to vaccination in patients with inflammatory bowel diseases

arm_group.description: Patients who have inflammatory bowel diseases and who give consent to participate in the survey

intervention.intervention_name: Survey with structured questionnaire form for inflammatory bowel disease patient group
intervention.description: For patients with inflammatory bowel disease, survey with structured questionnaire form is carried out.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with inflammatory bowel diseases who are visiting Asan Medical Center and who give consent to the survey

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Crohn's disease or ulcerative colitis
- Patients who are visiting Asan Medical Center for the first time for the management of inflammatory bowel diseases
- Patients who give consent for participating in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who refuse to participate in the study

reference.citation: Yeung JH, Goodman KJ, Fedorak RN. Inadequate knowledge of immunization guidelines: a missed opportunity for preventing infection in immunocompromised IBD patients. Inflamm Bowel Dis. 2012 Jan;18(1):34-40. doi: 10.1002/ibd.21668. Epub 2011 Feb 18.
